summary: The 'Mortgage Relief for Disaster Survivors Act' proposes providing forbearance assistance to borrowers with federally backed mortgages whose properties are damaged or destroyed by a major disaster or emergency.  Eligible borrowers can request a forbearance of up to 180 days, with the possibility of an extension.  During the forbearance, no fees or penalties beyond scheduled interest accrue. Key definitions include 'covered mortgage loan', 'covered period', 'disaster', 'disaster area,' and details on Federally backed mortgage loans.
